description: Erection of a single storey rear extension to the lower ground level, including replacement windows of rear elevation, windows to the lower ground and upper ground floor. Installation of two air conditioning units at the rear of the garden.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [PLA_001 P01, ELE_150 P01, PLA_200 P01, ELE_250 P01, PLA_100 P01, PLA_002 P01, ELE_350 P01, PLA_300 P01, Fire safety statement, Sound data, Received 13/03/2024, Design and Access statement received 03/05/2024
Noise Impact Assessment received 07/05/2024].
Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.
Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.
Condition : 4 - The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system etc operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 meter from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142; 
b)	The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.
Condition : 5 - Within 3 months of installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments.
